clinical_study.brief_title: Carotid Intima-media Thickness in Japan Statin Treatment Against Recurrent Stroke(J-STARS Echo)
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl-coenzyme A(HMG-CoA) Reductase Inhibitor Upon Carotid Intima-media Complex Thickness in the Post-ischemic Patients With Hyperlipidemia During the Prospective Study of J-STARS.

lead_sponsor.agency: Translational Research Center for Medical Innovation, Kobe, Hyogo, Japan

collaborator.agency: Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare, Japan

clinical_study.source: Translational Research Center for Medical Innovation, Kobe, Hyogo, Japan

brief_summary.textblock: Carotid ultrasound can reveal the intima-media complex thickness(IMT), that has been reported to be a marker of atherosclerosis as well as a risk of cardiovascular events, and to be attenuated by 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl-coenzyme A (HMG-CoA) reductase inhibitors (statins) . This substudy of J-STARS will observe the temporal profile of carotid IMT prospectively in the patients with prescription of pravastatin and the control.

primary_outcome.measure: Intima-media complex thickness (IMT) of the common carotid artery (CCA)
primary_outcome.time_frame: until the last day of the next February after 5-year follow-up survey

secondary_outcome.measure: Plaque score, number of plaque, recurrent cerebrovascular events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: until the last day of the next February after 5-year follow-up survey

arm_group.description: Patient has 10mg oral administration of Pravastatin per day. It starts within one month from their entry and continues every day until the end of the study or its endpoints.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ischemic stroke except for cardiogenic embolism, from 1 month to 3 years after onset
- Hyperlipidemia and total cholesterol level of 180-240mg/dl without the prescription of statin within previous 30 days
- Able to visit outpatient department
- Informed consent on the form.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Ischemic stroke of other determined cause according to the TOAST classification
- Ischemic heart disease and necessary to use statin
- Hemorrhagic disorders
- Platelet count <=100,000/ul within 3 months prior to study start
- Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) or aspartate aminotransferase (AST)>= 100IU/L within 3 months prior to study start
- Serum creatinine >=2.0mg/dl within 3 months prior to study start
- A scheduled operation
- The presence of malignant disorder
- Patients whom carotid ultrasound cannot examine because of neck tumor or torticollis
- Patients after carotid endarterectomy or radiation therapy to neck
- Patients whose carotid ultrasound cannot be examined because of neck tumor or torticollis
- Patients after carotid endarterectomy or radiation therapy to neck
